election_record.label: New Hampshire 1821 Governor

sub_unit.name: Hinsdale
sub_unit.note: Rejected, "not being returned to the Secretary's office within the time required by the Constitution." Farmer's Cabinet (Amherst, NH). June 9, 1821.

sub_unit.name: Roxbury
sub_unit.note: Rejected, "it not appearing by the returns that they were true copies of the record." Farmer's Cabinet (Amherst, NH). June 9, 1821.

sub_unit.name: Stewartstown
sub_unit.note: Rejected, "it not appearing by the returns that they were true copies of the record." Farmer's Cabinet (Amherst, NH). June 9, 1821.

sub_unit.name: Piermont
sub_unit.note: Rejected, "it not appearing that the votes were declared in open town meeting." Farmer's Cabinet (Amherst, NH). June 9, 1821.

sub_unit.name: Antrim
sub_unit.note: Rejected, "it not appearing that the votes were declared in open town meeting." Farmer's Cabinet (Amherst, NH). June 9, 1821.

sub_unit.name: Dunbarton
sub_unit.note: William Hale received 1 vote as William Hall.

sub_unit.name: Weare
sub_unit.note: There were no votes recorded in Weare.

sub_unit.name: Loudon
sub_unit.note: Rejected, "it not appearing by the returns that they were true copies of the record." Farmer's Cabinet (Amherst, NH). June 9, 1821.

sub_unit.name: Seabrook
sub_unit.note: Rejected, "not being returned to the Secretary's office within the time required by the Constitution." Farmer's Cabinet (Amherst, NH). June 9, 1821.

sub_unit.name: Barrington
sub_unit.note: Rejected, "it not appearing with certainty when the meeting was held" Farmer's Cabinet (Amherst, NH). June 9, 1821.

sub_unit.name: Brookfield
sub_unit.note: Rejected, "it not appearing that the votes were declared in open town meeting." Farmer's Cabinet (Amherst, NH). June 9, 1821.

sub_unit.name: Conway
sub_unit.note: "The Town Clerk of Conway having made two returns, stating in one that his excellency Samuel Bell had 191 votes for Governor, and in the other, that Jeremiah Mason had 12 votes for Governor - and certifying both to be true copies of the record, the committee have rejected both returns, because they directly contradict each other, and if both are true, neither can be a true copy of the record." Farmer's Cabinet (Amherst, NH). June 9, 1821.

sub_unit.name: Eaton
sub_unit.note: Samuel Bell received 182 votes as "for Gov".
Rejected, "it not appearing for whom they were given." Farmer's Cabinet (Amherst, NH). June 9, 1821.
